data.content:
noun
plural -oles
[count] :a person who has African and French or Spanish ancestors especially; :such a person who lives in the West Indies
[count] :a person whose ancestors were some of the first people from France or Spain to live in the southeastern U.S.
Creoles continue to have the same language and culture as their French or Spanish ancestors.
[noncount] :a language that is based on French and that uses words from African languages
Some people in Louisiana speak Creole.
Haitian Creole [=a type of Creole spoken in Haiti]
b creole [count] linguistics :a language that is based on one language but that has some words from another language

Danh từ
ngôn ngữ giả cầy
người Creon (người gốc Âu sống ở quần đảo Tây Ấn hoặc vùng châu Mỹ nói tiếng Tây Ban Nha; người gốc Pháp hoặc Tây Ban Nha sống ở các tiểu bang miền Nam nước Mỹ)
